trans-unit.source: Deploy and monitor a compliance policy | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Deploy and monitor a compliance policy | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the step-by-step instructions in this topic to deploy and monitor a device compliance policy.
trans-unit.target: Use the step-by-step instructions in this topic to deploy and monitor a device compliance policy.

trans-unit.source: Deploy and monitor a device compliance policy in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Deploy and monitor a device compliance policy in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Deploy a compliance policy
trans-unit.target: Deploy a compliance policy

trans-unit.source: Deploy the compliance policy you [created](create-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) to one or more groups of users in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Deploy the compliance policy you [created](create-a-device-compliance-policy-in-microsoft-intune.md) to one or more groups of users in your organization.

trans-unit.source: When a compliance policy is deployed to a user, the user's devices are checked for compliance.
trans-unit.target: When a compliance policy is deployed to a user, the user's devices are checked for compliance.

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the compliance policy page showing the Manage Deployment menu option at the top
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the compliance policy page showing the Manage Deployment menu option at the top

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, choose one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then choose **Add > OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, choose one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then choose **Add > OK**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot of the manage deployment dialog box](./media/intune-sa-3d-deploy-compliance-policy3-Manage.png) You can deploy a compliance policy to users.
trans-unit.target: Screenshot of the manage deployment dialog box](./media/intune-sa-3d-deploy-compliance-policy3-Manage.png) You can deploy a compliance policy to users.

trans-unit.source: Use Active Directory groups that you have already created and synced to Intune, or create these groups manually in the Intune console.
trans-unit.target: Use Active Directory groups that you have already created and synced to Intune, or create these groups manually in the Intune console.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how to deploy policies, see [deploy a configuration policy](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how to deploy policies, see [deploy a configuration policy](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace to identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
trans-unit.target: Use the status summary and alerts on the **Overview** page of the **Policy** workspace to identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the **Dashboard** workspace.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the **Dashboard** workspace.

trans-unit.source: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable an Exchange conditional access policy, all targeted devices will be allowed access.
trans-unit.target: If you have not deployed a compliance policy and then enable an Exchange conditional access policy, all targeted devices will be allowed access.

trans-unit.source: How Intune policy conflicts are resolved
trans-unit.target: How Intune policy conflicts are resolved

trans-unit.source: Policy conflicts can occur due when multiple Intune policies are applied to a device.
trans-unit.target: Policy conflicts can occur due when multiple Intune policies are applied to a device.

trans-unit.source: If the policy settings overlap, Intune resolves any conflicts using the following rules:
trans-unit.target: If the policy settings overlap, Intune resolves any conflicts using the following rules:

trans-unit.source: If the conflicting settings are from an Intune configuration policy and a compliance policy, the settings in the compliance policy take precedence over the settings in the configuration policy, even if the settings in the configuration policy are more secure.
trans-unit.target: If the conflicting settings are from an Intune configuration policy and a compliance policy, the settings in the compliance policy take precedence over the settings in the configuration policy, even if the settings in the configuration policy are more secure.

trans-unit.source: If you have deployed multiple compliance policies, the most secure of these policies will be used.
trans-unit.target: If you have deployed multiple compliance policies, the most secure of these policies will be used.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the compliance policy
trans-unit.target: Monitor the compliance policy

trans-unit.source: To view devices that do not conform to a compliance policy
trans-unit.target: To view devices that do not conform to a compliance policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Groups > All Devices**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Groups > All Devices**.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the name of a device in the list of devices.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the name of a device in the list of devices.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Policy** tab to see a list of the policies for that device.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Policy** tab to see a list of the policies for that device.

trans-unit.source: From the **Filters** drop-down list, select **Does not conform to compliance policy**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Filters** drop-down list, select **Does not conform to compliance policy**.

trans-unit.source: Screenshot showing the list of options in the filters list
trans-unit.target: Screenshot showing the list of options in the filters list

trans-unit.source: To view the Health Attestation Reports
trans-unit.target: To view the Health Attestation Reports

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Reports**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Health Attestation Report - Create a new report** page, you can view a report with all the Windows 10 health attestation data collected by Intune.
trans-unit.target: In the **Health Attestation Report - Create a new report** page, you can view a report with all the Windows 10 health attestation data collected by Intune.

trans-unit.source: You can also create a report with a subset of the data using filters.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a report with a subset of the data using filters.

trans-unit.source: The filters can be based on the type of device, operating system, or only a subset of data points.
trans-unit.target: The filters can be based on the type of device, operating system, or only a subset of data points.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can now use the compliance policy with conditional access policies to control access to services in your organization.
trans-unit.target: You can now use the compliance policy with conditional access policies to control access to services in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Restrict access to email and O365 services
trans-unit.target: Restrict access to email and O365 services

trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: Introduction to device compliance polices in Intune
